maml:description.maml:para: Set azure storage service CORS rules.

This cmdlet will set the CORS rules for a specified type of storage service (blob, table, queue). Note that it will overwrite the existing rules with the input CORS rules array. It is recommended to get the existing rules first before you set if you just want to add one rule as shown in example.
Azure storage service type, such as Blob, Table, Queue.
An array of PSCORSRule instances each to represent a CORS rule. You can retrieve the existing rules using Get-AzureStorageCORSRule
Azure Storage Context. You can create it by New-AzureStorageContext cmdlet.
Azure storage service type, such as Blob, Table, Queue.
An array of PSCORSRule instances each to represent a CORS rule.
Azure Storage Context. You can create it by New-AzureStorageContext cmdlet.

maml:alert.maml:para: Keywords: common, azure, services, data, storage, blob, queue, table

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Set two CORS rules to blob service. --------------------------
-------------------------- Change a CORS rule's properties of blob service. --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $corsRules = Get-AzureStorageCORSRule -ServiceType Blob PS C:\> $corsRules[0].AllowedHeaders = @("x-ms-blob-content-type", "x-ms-blob-content-disposition") PS C:\> $corsRules[0].AllowedMethods = @("Get", "Connect", "Merge") PS C:\> Set-AzureStorageCORSRule -ServiceType Blob -CorsRules $corsRules

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Start copy operation by name. --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Start-CopyAzureStorageContainer -SrcContainer container1 -SrcBlob blob1 -DestContainer container2

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Start copy operation using container pipeline from GetAzureStorageContainer. --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-AzureStorageContainer -Container container1 | Start-AzureStorageBlobCopy -SrcBlob blob -DestContainer container2

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- StartCopy to specified blob using pipeline from GetAzureStorageBlob --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-AzureStorageBlob -Container container1 | Start-AzureStorageBlobCopy -DestContainer container2

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- start copy operation to CloudBlob object --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> $srcBlob = Get-AzureStorageBlob -Container container1 -Blob srcBlob $destBlob = Get-AzureStorageBlob -Container container2 -Blob destBlob
Start-AzureStorageBlobCopy -CloudBlob $srcBlob.ICloudBlob -DestCloudBlob $destBlob.ICloudBlob

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Start copy operation using source uri --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> $context = New-AzureStorageContainer -StorageAccountName accountname -StorageAccountKey accountkey
Start-AzureStorageBlobCopy -SrcUri http://www.somesite.com/somefile -DestContainer container -DestBlob blob -DestContext $context

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Start copy from a secondary location --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> $SrcContext = New-AzureStorageContext -ConnectionString "DefaultEndpointsProtocol=https;AccountName=myaccount;AccountKey=***;BlobEndpoint=http://myaccount-secondary.blob.core.windows.net;FileEndpoint=http://myaccount-secondary.file.core.windows.net;QueueEndpoint=http://myaccount-secondary.queue.core.windows.net; TableEndpoint=http://myaccount-secondary.table.core.windows.net;"
Start-AzureStorageBlobCopy –Container sourcecontainer -Blob BlobName -Context $SrcContext –DestContainer destcontainer -DestBlob DestBlobName
